intro: Podolepis rugata subsp. rugata, commonly known as the roughleaf podolepis, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant features rough, hairy stems and leaves with a distinct, rugged texture. Its small white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
